javadoc:
Base interface for Defining methods for managing a "virtual" array of some data type.
 Any access of an Array with an index that has never been set will return 0 
 (or something like that depending on the data type)

methods.name: remove
methods.comment:
Removes the value at that index.  If the array is of primitive type (int, short, etc),
 then "removing" the value is equivilent to setting the value to 0;

params.name: index
params.comment: int index into the array to remove.

methods.javadoc: Returns the index of the last non-null or non-zero element in the array.
methods.name: getLastNonEmptyIndex
methods.comment: Returns the index of the last non-null or non-zero element in the array.

methods.name: copyDataTo
methods.comment:
Copies the underlying value for this array at the given index to the
 data table at the given index and column.  The data type at the column in
 the data table must be the same as the data in this array.

params.name: index
params.comment: index into this array to copy the value from.

params.name: table
params.comment: the data table object to copy the data to.

params.name: toIndex
params.comment:
the index into the destination data table to copy the
 value.

params.name: toCol
params.comment:
the data table column to store the value.  Must be the same
 type as this array.

name: Array
comment:
Base interface for Defining methods for managing a "virtual" array of some data type.
 Any access of an Array with an index that has never been set will return 0 
 (or something like that depending on the data type)
